biography:
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Robert William "Bob" Hoskins, Jr. (born 26 October 1942 – 29 April 2014) was an English actor, known for playing Cockney rough diamonds, psychopaths and gangsters, in films such as The Long Good Friday (1980), and Mona Lisa (1986), and lighter roles in Who Framed Roger Rabbit (1988) and Hook (1991).
name: Bob Hoskins
place_of_birth: Bury St. Edmunds, Suffolk, England, UK
